question: 浮かれる
sourceMnemonic: <ja>浮く</ja> means "to float," and <ja>浮かれる</ja> draws on that metaphor of "floating" to mean <vocabulary>to be happy</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to be in high spirits</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>to be elated</vocabulary>. We have the same metaphor in English — think of being "on cloud nine."
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from <ja>浮く</ja>, so if you know that you' are going <vocabulary>to be happy</vocabulary> and you won't have a <reading>care</reading> (<ja>かれる</ja>) in the world!
